intro: Scrophularia campanulata, commonly known as the bellflower scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep purple, blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scrophularia campanulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
